snippet: The decision was the latest in a long string of federal rulings ordering the state to ease overcrowding in its prisons.
abstract: Supreme Court rejects California's attempt to stop release of nearly 10,000 inmates from state prisons to relieve overcrowding, dealing blow to Gov Jerry Brown's efforts to fight federal court orders to reduce prison population.
lead_paragraph: The decision was the latest in a long string of federal rulings ordering the state to ease overcrowding in its prisons.

headline.main: Justices Rule California Must Free Some Inmates
headline.print_headline: Justices Rule California Must Free Some Inmates
